channel.title: Posts on Matt Waite's Github Site
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Matt Waite's Github Site

item.title: Fall 2021 Teaching and Learning Symposium Notes
item.description: What you’ll need: R 4.1.2 for your operating system R Studio A Github account Github desktop What you’ll do: Install everything. Open R studio In the console, type install.packages("bookdown") File > New Project New Directory > Book Project with Blogdown Pick a name, a location and a style of book. Write your book. Publishing your book Log into Github and create a new repository called yourusername.

item.title: How I (poorly) filled out my NCAA bracket with machine learning
item.description: I do not know a lot about college basketball. I follow the travails of my employer and a little about the Big Ten Conference as a whole, but at best it’s surface knowledge. I kinda know who is good that we’re going to play and who isn’t. Beyond that, nada. Which is bad when it comes to tournament time. My typical pattern of filling out bracket is Have I Heard Of This Team, Do They Have a Legendary Coach or Do I Hate Them For Some Reason.

item.title: Trying new table libraries
item.description: I’ve recently shifted my Sports Data Analysis and Visualization class from creating static graphics that get exported as a png graphic to creating blog posts. In doing so, the chapter on tables is not terribly useful or relevant. Exporting a visually interesting table to a png was not easy, so there’s a lot of code and content dedicated to that. It can go away now.
